com.defano.jmonet.tools.base

Class AbstractTransformTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.builder.PaintTool
      • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.AbstractSelectionTool
        • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.AbstractTransformTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanvasCommitObserver, SurfaceInteractionObserver, MutableSelection, Selection, MarchingAntsObserver, KeyListener, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PerspectiveTool, ProjectionTool, RubberSheetTool, ScaleTool, SlantTool

    public abstract class AbstractTransformTool
extends AbstractSelectionTool
    Mouse and keyboard handler for tools that define a bounding box with flexible corners that can be dragged into a desired position and shape.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractTransformTool(PaintToolType type)

    • Method Detail

      • moveTopLeft

        protected abstract void moveTopLeft(FlexQuadrilateral quadrilateral,
                                    Point newPosition,
                                    boolean isShiftDown)
        Invoked to indicate that the user has dragged/moved the top-left handle of the transform quadrilateral to a new position.
        Parameters:
        quadrilateral - The quadrilateral representing the transform bounds.
        newPosition - The new location of the affected drag handle.
        isShiftDown - True to indicate user is holding shift down; implementers may optionally use this flag to constrain drag movement or apply some other feature of the transform.

      • moveTopRight

        protected abstract void moveTopRight(FlexQuadrilateral quadrilateral,
                                     Point newPosition,
                                     boolean isShiftDown)
        Invoked to indicate that the user has dragged/moved the top-right handle of the transform quadrilateral to a new position.
        Parameters:
        quadrilateral - The quadrilateral representing the transform bounds.
        newPosition - The new location of the affected drag handle.
        isShiftDown - True to indicate user is holding shift down; implementers may optionally use this flag to constrain drag movement or apply some other feature of the transform.

      • createSelection

        public void createSelection(Rectangle bounds)
        Creates a selection bounded by the given rectangle. Equivalent to the user clicking and dragging from the top- left to the bottom-right of bounds.
        Overrides:
        createSelection in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        bounds - The selection rectangle to create.

      • createSelection

        public void createSelection(BufferedImage image,
                            Point location)
        Creates a selection containing the given image at the requested location on the canvas. The size of the selection will equal the bounds of the given image.
        Overrides:
        createSelection in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        image - The image contained by the selection. Note that the selection bounds will equal the bounds of this image.
        location - The location on the canvas where the selection (and image) will initially appear.

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e,
                         Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when a mouse button has been pressed on a component.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e,
                         Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when a mouse button is pressed on a component and then dragged. MOUSE_DRAGGED events will continue to be delivered to the component where the drag originated until the mouse button is released (regardless of whether the mouse position is within the bounds of the component).

        Due to platform-dependent Drag&Drop implementations, MOUSE_DRAGGED events may not be delivered during a native Drag&Drop operation.

        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Overrides:
        mouseDragged in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e,
                          Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when a mouse button has been released on a component.
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • addPointToSelectionFrame

        protected void addPointToSelectionFrame(Point initialPoint,
                                        Point newPoint,
                                        boolean isShiftKeyDown)
        Invoked to indicate that the user has defined a new point on the selection path.
        Specified by:
        addPointToSelectionFrame in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        initialPoint - The first point defined by the user (i.e., where the mouse was initially pressed)
        newPoint - A new point to append to the selection path (i.e., where the mouse is now)
        isShiftKeyDown - When true, indicates user is holding the shift key down

      • closeSelectionFrame

        protected void closeSelectionFrame(Point finalPoint)
        Invoked to indicate that the given point should be considered the last point in the selection path, and the path shape should be closed.
        Specified by:
        closeSelectionFrame in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        finalPoint - The final point on the selection path.

      • resetSelection

        public void resetSelection()
        Transitions to an un-selected state. Reset the selection boundary to its initial, no-selection state. Selection.getSelectionFrame() should return null following a selection reset, but prior to defining a new selection.

      • setSelectionOutline

        public void setSelectionOutline(Rectangle bounds)
        Specifies the selection rectangle (bounds) of the current selection, i.e., the rectangular path on which "marching ants" will be drawn.
        Parameters:
        bounds - The new selection bounds.

      • getSelectionFrame

        public Shape getSelectionFrame()
        Gets the current selection outline's shape and location, i.e., the path on the canvas where "marching ants" will be drawn. Note that the location of the shape's bounds is translated to the selection's location on the canvas. Use Selection.getIdentitySelectionFrame() for a selection outline located at (0, 0) and suitable for testing whether a pixel in the selected image is within the selection shape's mask.
        Returns:
        The selection outline's shape and location on the canvas

      • translateSelection

        public void translateSelection(int xDelta,
                               int yDelta)
        Invoked to indicate that the selection should be moved on the canvas and therefore the selection shape's coordinates should be translated accordingly.
        Parameters:
        xDelta - Number of pixels to move selection bounds horizontally.
        yDelta - Number of pixels to move selection bounds vertically.

      • getOriginalImage

        protected BufferedImage getOriginalImage()

      • drawSelectionFrame

        protected void drawSelectionFrame()
        Renders the selection outline (marching ants) on the canvas.
        Overrides:
        drawSelectionFrame in class AbstractSelectionTool
